comments.author: aprelle@hush.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/5.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; Media Center PC 6.0; .NET4.0C)

Steps to reproduce:

When started, firefox is frozen and does not respond to any mouse click or typing. This happened after some Microsoft security updates were automatically installed.


Actual results:

I uninstalled Firefox. I deleted c:\program files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox. I reinstalled Firefox. It still is frozen. I cannot even close firefox. I have to end the process through the task manager.
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/5.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; Media Center PC 6.0; .NET4.0C)

Steps to reproduce:

When started, firefox is frozen and does not respond to any mouse click or typing. This happened after some Microsoft security updates were automatically installed.


Actual results:

I uninstalled Firefox. I deleted c:\program files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox. I reinstalled Firefox. It still is frozen. I cannot even close firefox. I have to end the process through the task manager.

comments.text:
As soon as Firefox started, I hit 'Help' and restarted in safe mode. I noticed there is a second or two before it freezes entirely to do this.

After starting in safemode, it seems to work, but what is the solution to unfreeze it now?
comments.raw_text:
As soon as Firefox started, I hit 'Help' and restarted in safe mode. I noticed there is a second or two before it freezes entirely to do this.

After starting in safemode, it seems to work, but what is the solution to unfreeze it now?
comments.author: aprelle@hush.com
comments.creator: aprelle@hush.com

comments.raw_text:
The safemode is doing 2 things but the important thing is that it disables all installed extensions.
Please manually disable all installed extensions in (alt key)/tools/addons/extensions and restart Firefox in the normal mode.
comments.text:
The safemode is doing 2 things but the important thing is that it disables all installed extensions.
Please manually disable all installed extensions in (alt key)/tools/addons/extensions and restart Firefox in the normal mode.
